title: YouTuber PewDiePie shares sweet wedding throwback with Marzia Kjellberg
text:
PewDiePie married Marzia Bisognin two months ago (Picture: Instagram)

PewDiePie has shared a sweet wedding throwback celebrating two months since his marriage to Marzia Kjellberg.

The Swedish YouTuber married his long-term girlfriend, then Marzia Bisognin, after eight years together in an extravagant ceremony at London’s Kew Gardens in August.

Sharing four new photos from the wedding to his Instagram page, PewDiePie – real name Felix Kjellberg – commented ‘2 months ago today’ with a smiley face.

In the emotional wedding video posted after the ceremony, the 29-year-old said: ‘I am most of all happy and grateful to finally be Marzia’s husband.

‘We met at a time where I was feeling very lost, but every day since I met Marzia has been the best days of my life.

‘Marzia has taught me to always go for what you want, without any hesitation, and that has opened my life to so many new experiences that I never would have even dreamed to be possible.

Tearing up, he added: ‘But most importantly, Marzia brings out the best in me and I feel so fortunate to be spending the rest of my life with this amazing woman.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The couple recently went to Japan on their second honeymoon – during which Marzia suffered from a gruesome toe injury – and Felix recently revealed that they’ve bought a house there and are planning to move for a bit.

PewDiePie looked very smart on the couple’s big day. (Picture: Instagram/@pewdiepie)

PewDiePie and Marzia were joined by their family for the big day (Picture: Instagram/@pewdiepie)

‘It’s like we’ve just got set up in the UK and now we’re leaving,’ he said in a recent video, revealing that the couple are planning to stay in Tokyo.

‘I don’t know how long we’ll stay in Japan – it depends on tax and visas.’

This looks like fun… (Picture: Instagram/@pewdiepie)

Previously revealing that he’d bought a property over there, he said: ‘Hey, remember a while back when last time I was in Japan, and I was like “I would really like to live here”?

‘Well, we bought a house here, yay! So we are just here for a couple of days setting up. That’s why I don’t have my whole set up and everything is terrible. I just wanted to say thank you, it’s a dream come true!’

Turning the conversation to Brexit, the YouTuber admitted: ‘I benefit from Brexit. I get less taxes but I don’t support it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘That’s the good thing about Europe, you can travel to other countries and live there if you want to.’

description: Swedish YouTuber Felix Kjellberg - aka PewDiePie - is celebrating his two-month anniversary with wife Marzia.
